business.headline: Pakistan's economy set to grow 2.7% in FY25: ReportPakistan's central bank, in a bid to encourage growth, cut its policy rate by more than 1,000 basis points in the current fiscal year. Its latest cut last month brought the key rate to 11%, resuming an easing cycle that had brought rates down from 22% after a brief pause in March.
Sensex settles over 200 points; Nifty above 25,100; Kotak Bank gains 3%The S&P BSE Sensex was up 256.22 points to close at 82,445.21, while the NSE Nifty50 added 100.20 points to end at 25,103.20.

Who is Sashidhar Jagdishan? HDFC Bank CEO under financial fraud lensSashidhar Jagdishan has been a part of HDFC Bank since 1996. He joined as a manager in the finance division and quickly rose through the ranks.

Shein, Reliance aim to sell India-made clothes globally within a year: ReportThe aim is to make Shein-branded clothes in India not just for local sales but also for international markets, starting with the US and UK, within the next 6 to 12 months.
Gautam Adani earned Rs 10.41 crore in FY25: Who earned more than him?Gautam Adani earned Rs 10.41 crore in the financial year 2024–25, which is much less than several leading business heads in India.

RBI's bumper rate cut leaves rupee exposed to fresh depreciation riskThe rupee has already lagged behind its Asian peers in 2025, weighed down by tepid capital inflows. Now, with the RBI easing faster than the US Federal Reserve, the narrowing interest rate differential is expected to keep the rupee on the back foot.

HDFC Bank and BoB cut lending rates after RBI repo rate slashBorrowers can expect EMIs on home loans, personal loans, and other credit products to come down slightly, offering a bit of breathing space amid rising living costs.

Income Tax ramps up checks on big transactions with new filing and TDS rulesThe Income Tax Department has ramped up efforts to spot individuals who spend heavily but may be hiding their real income, using data analytics and tighter links with financial institutions.
Currency devaluation is quietly eating into your wealth, expert warnsYour money or assets might look the same in your account, but its real value could be slipping away every year, warns expert.

India's $80 billion coal-power boom is running short of water: ReportThirty-seven of the 44 new projects named in the undated power ministry shortlist of future operations are located in areas that the government classifies as either suffering from water scarcity or stress.

World's largest container ship MSC IRINA docks at Vizhinjam SeaportMSC IRINA's docking at Vizhinjam International Seaport signals growing confidence in the port's readiness to handle Ultra-Large Container Vessels (ULCVs).
Sensex opens 382 points higher, Nifty above 25,100; Axis Bank gains over 1%The S&P BSE Sensex added 335.02 points to 82,524.01, while the NSE Nifty50 added 114.85 points to 25,117.90 as of 9:28 am.

entertainment.headline: Actor Suriya in Hyderabad with daughter Diya ahead of Venky Atluri's film shoot'Retro' actor Suriya was seen in Hyderabad airport, making a rare public appearance with his daughter Diya. Reports suggest that he is in Hyderabad to shoot for his upcoming project with 'Lucky Bhaskar' director Venky Atluri.

Ekta Kapoor calls Anurag Kashyap classist for saas-bahu jibe on Netflix CEOFilmmaker Anurag Kashyap recently criticised Netflix CEO Ted Sarandos' statement, mentioning that he should have started with more populist content instead of 'Sacred Games' in India. Producer Ekta Kapoor responded to Kashyap, calling him a classist for referring to the saas-bahu dramas.

No bigger reward: Anurag Kashyap on daughter's reaction to Black FridayFilmmaker Anurag Kashyap opened up about his daughter's admiration for his cult classic Black Friday. He reflected on the lasting impact of his work and shares insights on his journey and collaborations.

Edagaiye Apaghatakke Karana trailer promises quirky crime comedy starring DiganthThe recently released trailer of the upcoming Kannada film, 'Edagaiye Apaghatakke Karana' starring Diganth, Nidhi Subbaiah and Dhanu Harsha in the lead, presents a black comedy thriller packed with situational comedy and four murders.

Lyricist Vairamuthu calls out Tamil filmmakers for using his verses as film titlesLyricist Vairamuthu criticised Tamil filmmakers for using his verses as Tamil film titles. His post on X drew mixed responses as many X users pointed out that the lyrics feature words that have been in Tamil scripture for eons.

A month after his exit, Paresh Rawal reacts to fan calling him hero of Hera PheriActor Paresh Rawal answered a fan on X who called him the 'hero' of the 'Hera Pheri' franchise. He responded with a humble gesture, adding a folded-hands emoji.

Ranbir Kapoor, Alia Bhatt's Rs 250 crore dream home is ready. Check videoRanbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt's new home in Mumbai is almost ready to move in. Once the finishing touches are completed in a month, the couple will find an auspicious time to conduct the grah pravesh puja.

Navjot Singh Sidhu re-enters Kapil Sharma Show, Archana Puran Singh in shock. WatchNavjot Singh Sidhu is set to make a comeback on 'The Great Indian Kapil Show.' Makers released a new video and announced the news.

What went wrong with Kamal Haasan and Mani Ratnam's Thug Life?Kamal Haasan and director Mani Ratnam's 'Thug Life' had all the ingredients for a gripping gangster saga. It marked the reunion of legendary collaborators, featured a powerful cast, and stunning technical craft, yet, it faltered by trying to juggle too many themes and underdeveloped storylines.

Govinda's wife Sunita feels actor not getting work because of chaplus circleActor Govinda's wife, Sunita Ahuja, recently said he had not been getting work for the past 17 years because of his circle. Sunita stated that the actor seeks feedback from people who would give him wrong piece of advice.

Smriti Irani, Amar Upadhyay to Mouni Roy, celebs at Ektaa Kapoor's birthday bashProducer Ektaa Kapoor celebrated her 50th birthday with the who's of who of Bollywood and the Indian television industry on June 7. However, it was the reunion of 'Kyunki Saas Bhi Kabhi Bahu Thi' starcast, including actor turned politician Smriti Irani and actor Amar Upadhyay, that created excitement among the fans. Karan Johar, Manish Malhotra, Krystle DSouza, Anita Hassanandani, Jeetendra and Tusshar Kapoor also attended the party.

Baahubali films to be clubbed, trimmed for theatrical re-release version: ReportWhat SS Rajamouli's 'Baahubali' films did for Indian cinema is a pure case study. The makers earlier announced that the film will be re-released in theatres soon, and now, there's a new update on the same.

R Madhavan teams up with Priyanka, Mahesh Babu for Rajamouli's SSMB29: ReportR Madhavan has reportedly joined the team of SS Rajamouli's upcoming film 'SSMB29' starring Priyanka Chopra and Mahesh Babu.
Veteran filmmaker Partho Ghosh dies of heart attack at 75, tributes pour inDirector Partho Ghosh died due to a heart attack. He was 75.

Chris Hemsworth's Thor 5 could be in the works, and why that is a brilliant ideaThere's a lot that needs exploring in the 'Thor' universe, and if the MCU has planned 'Thor 5' in its next saga post-'Avengers: Secret Wars', then it's absolutely going to be a master-stroke.

Is Samantha holidaying with Raj Nidimoru in Abu Dhabi? Internet thinks soActor Samantha Ruth Prabhu recently shared photos from her Abu Dhabi holiday.  The Internet thinks that she is holidaying with filmmaker Raj Nidimoru, her rumoured boyfriend.

Playing with pets, catching up with friends: Inside Priyanka's quick home tripPriyanka Chopra shared a bunch of pictures from her 'quick trip home' in LA. Starting from her playtime with pets to catching up with friends, everything was adorable.

Housefull 5 box office Day 3: Akshay's film eyes Rs 100 crore after 1st weekendAkshay Kumar's 'Housefull 5' earned Rs 87 crore in three days. The film directed by Tarun Mansukhani is now inching closer to the Rs 100 crore mark.

Virat, Anushka are soulmates incomplete without each other: IPL photographerPhotojournalist Arun Sharma, who covered IPL 2025, described Anushka Sharma and Virat Kohli's bond after RCB's victory over Punjab Kings. He shared their sweet moments after RCB's first IPL win.

general news.headline: 2 sharp wounds to head, from front and back: Meghalaya tourist's autopsyDays after a couple from Madhya Pradesh went missing in Meghalaya, the husband, Raja Raghuvanshi, was found dead in a forest. His wife Sonam, who was earlier reported missing, has now emerged as the one who allegedly hired hitmen for Raja's murder.

Honeymoon murder, wife caught, 'lover' arrested: What we know about Meghalaya caseAccording to Raja's brother, Vipul, and sources, Sonam's alleged lover, Raj Kushwaha, was an employee at her father's plywood factory. 'They would constantly talk on phone,' Vipul said, adding, 'I have never seen Raj Kushwaha till now, I have just heard his name.' Raj Kushwaha, who is reportedly five years younger, has been arrested by the Indore Police.

After deleting Epstein post, Elon Musk endorses Trump post. Signs of patch-up?Trump, in his post, has called for an apology from Governor Gavin Newsom and Mayor Karen Bass over the recent violence in the city as protestors took to the streets following the US President's sweeping crackdown on undocumented immigrants.

Meet Peggy Whitson, legendary Ax-4 commander guiding Indian astronautIndian astronaut Shubhanshu Shukla, call sign Shux, will fly to space alongside Mission Commander Peggy Whistos, and two other astronauts from Poland and Hungry.

What went wrong with Kamal Haasan and Mani Ratnam's Thug Life?Kamal Haasan and director Mani Ratnam's 'Thug Life' had all the ingredients for a gripping gangster saga. It marked the reunion of legendary collaborators, featured a powerful cast, and stunning technical craft, yet, it faltered by trying to juggle too many themes and underdeveloped storylines.

Bengaluru woman allegedly killed by techie boyfriend in hotel roomA 33-year-old woman was allegedly murdered by a 25-year-old techie in a Bengaluru hotel. The two were close, but she had been distancing herself, said police. Angered by this, he reportedly stabbed her to death.

Orange alert in Delhi-NCR for next 3 days, temperatures may hit 45°C tomorrowThe yellow warning regarding a heat wave prevailing in Delhi for the next three days, has now been upgraded to an orange one. The humidity levels were also as high as 70 per cent in the national capital on Sunday night.

India asserts, Pak deflects: Tale of two narratives in Washington after Operation SindoorWhat played out in Washington was more than a series of bilateral meetings. It was a tale of two nations, heading in opposite directions.

Will Pak army blink? Buzz of ex-PM Imran Khan's release on June 11A claim by a senior leader of the PTI, Gohar Ali Khan, that Imran Khan may walk free on June 11 has ignited speculation that Army Chief Asim Munir is caving under pressure. The claim comes after Imran Khan last week vowed to lead a nationwide agitation from behind bars, at a time when the Munir-led army appears to be on the back foot.

RCB, event organisers move Karnataka High Court to cancel case over stampedeEvent management firm DNA Entertainment Networks and IPL franchise Royal Challengers Bengaluru have approached the Karnataka High Court seeking to cancel the police case against them over the fatal stampede at Chinnaswamy Stadium in Bengaluru.

Who is Chennai techie Ashok Elluswamy, set to lead Tesla's humanoid projectIndian-American engineer, Ashok Elluswamy, the director of Tesla Autopilot Software, will now lead the company's Optimus Humanoid Robot Programme following the exit of its former head, Milan Kovac. The Chennai-educated engineer, who has been with Tesla for over 11 years, is an expert in artificial intelligence.

If veg, why choose non-veg joint? Consumer forum rejects plea against food outletThe consumer forum dismissed a complaint against a food outlet in Mumbai over an alleged non-vegetarian mix-up, citing lack of evidence.

Meet Dr Madhavi Latha, the IISc professor behind world's highest Chenab bridgeThe recently inaugurated Chenab Bridge in Jammu and Kashmir, which now connects Srinagar to the rest of the country through the railway network, faced many challenges during its construction. These obstacles might have remained unresolved if not for the dedicated efforts of several individuals, including IISc professor Dr Madhavi Latha. Here's a brief look at her journey and work.

Astronaut Shubhanshu Shukla cracked NDA on his sister's wedding dayHe had left the house in his wedding attire and returned looking visibly tired, but immediately rejoined the wedding preparations without explaining his absence.
Elon made a mistake, Trump will prevail: Errol Musk days after son's public feudErrol Musk also suggested that the row "was just a small thing" and would "be over tomorrow".

Four dead after falling off overcrowded local train in Mumbai, several injuredThe incident occurred between Diva and Kopar railway stations of the Central Railway when 5 people fell on the railway tracks from an overcrowded train.

Why young Indians are sitting on a ticking time bomb of diseasesYoung Indians increasingly face chronic lifestyle diseases despite appearing healthy. This silent epidemic demands urgent lifestyle and policy changes.

Humpback whale entangled in rope off Sydney coast, rescue teams race against timeThe whale was about eight metres (25 feet) long, a whale rescue group official said, indicating it was still "quite young". The rope appeared to be tangled around the whale's left pectoral fin.

Was abducted, robbed: Indore woman caught for husband's murder told UP dhaba ownerThe dhaba owner, Sahil Yadav, told India Today TV that Sonam claimed an attempt was made to rob her of her ornaments in Meghalaya, after which she fell unconscious and had no idea how she ended up there. Both Sahil and Govind had alerted the local police, who rushed to the spot and took her into custody.

Money can't buy love, Elon Musk is the latest in Silicon Valley to learn thisAs US President Donald Trump puts it — it is over between him and Elon Musk. And Musk has likely learnt, probably again, that all the money in the world is not enough to buy love.

A dating app nearly banned Geminis. Are they really that hard to date?No Names, a new socialising app, once put a filter on Geminis. While it has since been removed, here's decoding whether they're really difficult to date (plus, what they're actually looking for).

Explosion on Singaporean cargo ship off Kerala coast, 4 crew members missingA container ship bearing the Singapore flag with 22 crew members on board caught fire off the coast of Beypore, Kozhikode in Kerala. An explosion was reported on board the cargo vessel MV Wan Hai, and four crew members are reported missing.

Meghalaya honeymoon case: Wife had 'affair', got hitmen to kill husband, detainedIndore tourist Raja Raghuvanshi was allegedly killed by men hired by his wife, Sonam, during their honeymoon, Meghalaya Director General of Police Idashisha Nongrang said.

Who is Sashidhar Jagdishan? HDFC Bank CEO under financial fraud lensSashidhar Jagdishan has been a part of HDFC Bank since 1996. He joined as a manager in the finance division and quickly rose through the ranks.

sports.headline: Kuldeep Yadav could be a key bowler for India during England tour: Matthew HaydenMatthew Hayden believes Kuldeep Yadav will play a crucial role for India in the upcoming England Test series. Hayden emphasises the need for a reliable spinner in the side, highlighting the series as a tough challenge for India.

HazleGod: Josh Hazlewood and Australian teammates react to pacer's new nicknameJosh Hazlewood reacts to his new nickname 'HazleGod' after a stellar IPL 2025 season. Mitchell Starc and Nathan Lyon also commented on Hazlewood's new nickname ahead of the WTC final.

India train at Lord's, Aussies turned away before WTC final in fresh row: ReportAustralia were initially denied permission to train at Lord's on Saturday, just four days before their World Test Championship final against South Africa. Australian media reported that the Indian team, led by Shubman Gill, were granted access to train at the venue on the same day.

Cristiano Ronaldo defends Lamine Yamal after Nations League win: Leave him aloneCristiano Ronaldo has jumped to the defence of Lamine Yamal, saying that the Spanish sensation should be left alone and given his space. Yamal had a lacklustre outing in the final of the Nations League against Portugal.

Pollution problems? BCCI shifts November Test out of Delhi in fixtures overhaulThe Indian cricket board announced a revised home season schedule for the Test series against West Indies and South Africa later this year. A Test match in Delhi, which was originally scheduled for November, has been moved to Kolkata.

When Jasprit Bumrah gave Cameron Green confidence with special message before surgeryCameron Green revealed that Jasprit Bumrah reached out to the Australian all-rounder before he underwent back surgery late last year. Green is all set to make a return to the Australia lineup for the World Test Championship final against South Africa.

After French Open win, Carlos Alcaraz left sad as Spain lose Nations League finalCarlos Alcaraz was left distraught after Spain lost their UEFA Nations League final against Portugal on Sunday, June 9. Alcaraz secured a comeback win against Jannik Sinner while Spain were beaten on penalties.

For Portugal, would have broken my leg: Cristiano Ronaldo on Nations League final injuryCristiano Ronaldo revealed that he played through pain in the final of the UEFA Nations League against Spain on Sunday, June 8. Ronaldo scored the equaliser in the game as Portugal won their second Nations League title with a win on penalties.

3 winners in Paris: Federer's heartwarming post after epic French Open finalRoger Federer posted a heartwarming message for Carlos Alcaraz and Jannik Sinner after their epic French Open final on Sunday, June 8. Alcaraz staged a stunning comeback to beat Sinner in five sets.

Sinner explains why his father had to skip French Open final vs AlcarazJannik Sinner explained the reason why his father had to miss the epic French Open 2025 final against Carlos Alcaraz on Sunday, June 8. Sinner lost an epic battle against Alcaraz which went on for 5 hours and 29 minutes.

5 Grand Slams at 22 years, 1 month, 3 days, like Nadal: Alcaraz calls it destinyCarlos Alcaraz called it destiny as he levelled Rafael Nadal's tally of grand slam wins at the same age with his thrilling comeback against Jannik Sinner in the final of the French Open 2025 on Sunday, June 8.

After French Open win, Carlos Alcaraz left sad as Spain lose Nations League finalCarlos Alcaraz was left distraught after Spain lost their UEFA Nations League final against Portugal on Sunday, June 9. Alcaraz secured a comeback win against Jannik Sinner while Spain were beaten on penalties.

For Portugal, would have broken my leg: Cristiano Ronaldo on Nations League final injuryCristiano Ronaldo revealed that he played through pain in the final of the UEFA Nations League against Spain on Sunday, June 8. Ronaldo scored the equaliser in the game as Portugal won their second Nations League title with a win on penalties.

3 winners in Paris: Federer's heartwarming post after epic French Open finalRoger Federer posted a heartwarming message for Carlos Alcaraz and Jannik Sinner after their epic French Open final on Sunday, June 8. Alcaraz staged a stunning comeback to beat Sinner in five sets.

Sinner explains why his father had to skip French Open final vs AlcarazJannik Sinner explained the reason why his father had to miss the epic French Open 2025 final against Carlos Alcaraz on Sunday, June 8. Sinner lost an epic battle against Alcaraz which went on for 5 hours and 29 minutes.

5 Grand Slams at 22 years, 1 month, 3 days, like Nadal: Alcaraz calls it destinyCarlos Alcaraz called it destiny as he levelled Rafael Nadal's tally of grand slam wins at the same age with his thrilling comeback against Jannik Sinner in the final of the French Open 2025 on Sunday, June 8.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
